Key Match Events: Pete Alonso hit a three-run home run in the first inning
The Mets scored eight early runs
Francisco Alvarez hit three balls hard, including a double
Ryne Stanek provided 2 1/3 innings of competent relief pitching
Edwin Díaz got the last six outs
Pre-Game Insights: Mets manager Carlos Mendoza sensed a mix of strong preparation and smiles in the hitters' meeting
The Mets played tough from the jump and showed their desire to win
Starling Marte went 4-for-4 with three doubles
The Mets have their best starter, Sean Manaea, ready to pitch on an extra day of rest for Game 6
Post-Match Reflections: The Mets are here to fight for it
The Mets’ bullpen remains a concern, especially with the lack of trusted options
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jack Flaherty’s fastball averaged 91.4 mph, nearly 2 mph below his season average
Flaherty issued four walks and repeatedly fell behind in counts
The Mets clobbered Flaherty with five extra-base hits
